projectsArray.title: PROJECT: BSZ
description: I designed and developed this fully responsive webapp in React, utilising various npm libraries like React-Router, React-Breakpoints to achieve this layout. The contact form uses EmailJS to handle outgoing emails, so no back-end was set up for this project.
I wanted to make a site where I could showcase my personal projects that I have been working on, without the hassle of manually making new pages on a static website.

Half way through the project I discovered a more effective way to make every part of the app editable through a CMS system. If I was to remake this website, I would utilise Gatsby.js and Netlify CMS to make the every part of the application editable.

projectsArray.title: TO-DO APP
userStories: The user can add to-do item
The user can filter the list of to-dos
The user can tick off to-to item, to mark it as completed (cross-out)
The user can remove to-do item
The user can clear the list
The user can reset the original state

projectsArray.title: QUOTE-GEN
userStories: The user can generate quotes from API (quote, author)
The user can share quotes on Twitter

projectsArray.title: MOVIE-APP
userStories: The user can search for movies by entering year
The user can navigate through the top 10 movies in a given year
